trans-unit.source: Configures a service credential.
Use this class to specify the credential for the service such as an X.509 certificate.
Also, use this class to specify the authentication model for various client credentials such as user name and password validation.

This class is used as a parameter in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityBindingElement.BuildChannelListenerCore%2A> method, by methods of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.ServiceCredentialsSecurityTokenManager>, and is returned by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase.Credentials%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials"></xref> from the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials"></xref> instance used to initialize the new instance.
Gets the current client certificate authentication and provisioning settings for this service.
You can specify a client certificate authentication model using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimTypes.Authentication%2A> property.

In the mutual certificate duplex scenario, you can specify an X.509 certificate to use in a response or callback using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.X509CertificateInitiatorClientCredential.Certificate%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.X509CertificateInitiatorServiceCredential"></xref> instance.
Creates a copy of the current instance.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials"></xref> instance.
Copies the essential members of the current instance.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials.CloneCore%2A> method calls the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceCredentials"></xref> instance.
Creates a token manager for this service.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.ServiceCredentialsSecurityTokenManager"></xref> instance.
Gets or sets the exception mapper associated with the service credentials.
The exception mapper associated with the service credentials.
Gets or sets the identity configuration for the service.
The identity configuration for the service.
Gets the current issued token (for example, SAML) authentication settings for this service.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.IssuedTokenServiceCredential"></xref> instance.
Gets the current credential authentication and provisioning settings to be used by peer transport endpoints configured on the service.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.PeerCredential"></xref> instance.
Gets the current settings to be used by a secure conversation.
Use this class to specify a list of known claim types for the Security Context Token (SCT) cookies serialization and an encoder to encode and secure cookies information.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecureConversationServiceCredential"></xref> instance.
Gets the current certificate associated with this service.
You can specify the certificate to use by calling members of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.X509CertificateRecipientServiceCredential> object returned by this property.
You can also set this value using the [\<certificate\>](~/docs/framework/configure-apps/file-schema/wcf/certificate-for-identity.md) element in a client application configuration file.
An <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.X509CertificateRecipientServiceCredential"></xref> instance.
Gets or sets whether the service credential uses identity configuration.
`True` if the service credential uses identity configuration; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the current user name/password authentication settings for this service.

You can specify the settings of the user name/password authentication by calling members of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.UserNamePasswordServiceCredential> class on this instance, such as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.UserNamePasswordServiceCredential.UserNamePasswordValidationMode%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.UserNamePasswordServiceCredential.MembershipProvider%2A>.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.UserNamePasswordServiceCredential"></xref> instance.
Gets the current Windows authentication settings for this service.
Use this class to specify whether to allow anonymous Windows users access by setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WindowsServiceCredential.AllowAnonymousLogons%2A> property.

Also, use this class to specify whether to include a group information to which users belong in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Policy.AuthorizationContext> by setting the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WindowsServiceCredential.IncludeWindowsGroups%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WindowsServiceCredential"></xref> instance.
Adds this instance to a binding parameter collection.
This is an infrastructure method and not intended to be called directly.
Some binding elements can sometimes access extra information when building factories.
This class is a collection of objects that contain this extra information.
A description of the service.
The service host base.
A collection of service endpoints.
A collection of parameters.
parameters is `null`.
Apply the dispatch behavior.
This is an infrastructure method and not intended to be called directly.
Not implemented.
The service description.
The service host base.
Validates a service description.
This is an infrastructure method and not intended to be called directly.
Not implemented.
The service description.
The service host base.
